meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel sudden shock or alarm.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunder startles my dog.
meanings.sent2: She startles easily at unexpected noises.
meanings.sent3: The cat startles the mouse with a playful pounce.
meanings.sent4: The sudden clap of thunder startles the sleeping baby awake.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected fire alarm startles everyone in the building.

meanings.definition: To be surprised or frightened by a sudden noise or movement.
meanings.sent1: He startles when the door slams shut.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit startles and runs away at the sound of footsteps.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel startles the birds when it jumps from branch to branch.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected flash of lightning startles the hiker on the trail.
meanings.sent5: The sudden burst of fireworks startles the crowd at the celebration.
